intro: Sinclairia hypoleuca, commonly known as the white-flowered sinclairia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens. Sinclairia hypoleuca is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
